title: 1946 Wyoming gubernatorial election
text: The 1946 Wyoming gubernatorial election took place on November 5, 1946. Incumbent Democratic Governor <a href="Lester%20C.%20Hunt">Lester C. Hunt</a> ran for re-election to a second term. Former Republican Governor <a href="Nels%20H.%20Smith">Nels H. Smith</a>, whom Hunt defeated in <a href="1942%20Wyoming%20gubernatorial%20election">1942</a>, announced that he would challenge Hunt for re-election, but he was defeated the Republican primary by State Treasurer Earl Wright. In the general election, even though the Republican Party had a strong performance <a href="1946%20United%20States%20elections">nationwide</a>, Wyoming Democrats did well; Hunt defeated Wright by a wider margin than his 1942 victory as Democratic U.S. Senator <a href="Joseph%20C.%20O%27Mahoney">Joseph C. O'Mahoney</a> similarly won another term.
